meanings.definition: The act of entering or going into a place
meanings.sent1: The infares of the students into the school were filled with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The infares of visitors into the museum were smooth and orderly.
meanings.sent3: The infares of the cats into the house caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The infares of the sunlight into the room brightened up the space.
meanings.sent5: The infares of the new employee into the team brought fresh perspectives.

meanings.definition: A fee or tax paid upon entering a town or city
meanings.sent1: The infares collected at the city gates helped maintain the roads.
meanings.sent2: The infares imposed on merchants entering the market were reasonable.
meanings.sent3: The infares paid by travelers were used to beautify the town square.
meanings.sent4: The infares acted as a barrier for those seeking to enter the bustling city.
meanings.sent5: The infares were a small price to pay for the benefits of city life.

meanings.definition: The act of welcoming someone into a place
meanings.sent1: The warm infares of the host made the guests feel at home.
meanings.sent2: The infares extended to the new neighbors were heartfelt.
meanings.sent3: The infares of the children into the playground were met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: The infares of the team captain into the game boosted morale.
meanings.sent5: The infares of the ambassador into the country symbolized peace and friendship.
